openblocks.yacodeblocks
Interface AndroidController

All Known Implementing Classes:
YaCodeblocksAndroidController
public interface AndroidController

An AndroidController for codeblocks provides access to an external environment for cases where codeblocks needs to communicate with an android device. An AndroidController instance is designed to manage a particular application on the phone (referred to as "the application" in the method comments below). It can manage multiple devices. At most one device at a time can be the "selected device" that is running the application. This code is not located in third_party so that we don't call into the android third_party code from the codeblocks third_party code.

Author:
kerr@google.com (Debby Wallach)

Method Detail

setDeviceListener

void setDeviceListener(AndroidController.DeviceConnectionListener listener)
Provide methods to be called when a device is connected or disconnected.

Parameters:
listener -

androidInitializeCommunicationBridge

boolean androidInitializeCommunicationBridge(String adbLocation)
Cause the external controller to initialize the communication bridge to the android.

Parameters:
adbLocation - must contain the fully-qualified location of adb on the system.
Returns:
true iff the initialization was successful.

androidRestartBridge

boolean androidRestartBridge()
Restart the android communication bridge. Returns true if the restart succeeds, else false.

androidSyncAndInstallStarterApplication

void androidSyncAndInstallStarterApplication()
                                             throws AndroidControllerException,
                                                    ExternalStorageException
Cause the external controller to synchronize and install the application that this class is designed for to the selected device. Throws an exception if this fails for any reason (including there not being a device).

Throws:
AndroidControllerException
ExternalStorageException

androidSyncAndInstallSpecificApplication

void androidSyncAndInstallSpecificApplication(String apkFilePath,
                                              String appName,
                                              String packageName)
                                              throws AndroidControllerException,
                                                     ExternalStorageException
Cause the external controller to synchronize and install the specified application to the selected device. Throws an exception if this fails for any reason (including there not being a device).

Parameters:
apkFilePath - is the location of the application on the local file system.
appName - is the name of the application.
packageName - is the name of the package. It might look something like "com.gmail.USERNAME.";
Throws:
AndroidControllerException
ExternalStorageException

androidIsStarterApplicationRunning

boolean androidIsStarterApplicationRunning()
Query the external controller whether the selected device has the starter application running on it.

Returns:
true if it is. false if there is no selected device or the app is not running.

androidStartStarterApplication

void androidStartStarterApplication()
                                    throws AndroidControllerException
Cause the external controller to start the starter application. May throw an exception if the start fails. Will not re-start the application if it is already running.

Throws:
AndroidControllerException

androidKillStarterApplication

void androidKillStarterApplication()
Attempts to kill starter application on the selected device, if any.

androidKillSpecificApplication

void androidKillSpecificApplication(String packageName)
Attempts to kill specified application on the selected device, if any.

androidForwardTcpPort

boolean androidForwardTcpPort(int localPort,
                              int remotePort)
Cause the external controller to create a port forwarding between a local and a remote port. This is useful if you are creating a socket level connection to the application running on the device.

Returns:
true iff successful

androidCleanUpBeforeExit

void androidCleanUpBeforeExit()
Tells the external controller to clean things up. Must be called before the code exits.

pushFileToDevice

void pushFileToDevice(String fileToPush,
                      String remotePath)
                      throws AndroidControllerException,
                             ExternalStorageException
Copy a file onto the selected device.

Parameters:
fileToPush - the file to copy
remotePath - the full path to copy the file to on the phone
Throws:
AndroidControllerException
ExternalStorageException - if it appears that the external storage is not mounted on the device

selectDevice

void selectDevice(String device)
                  throws AndroidControllerException
Make device the currently selected device. device should have previously been provided as an argument to deviceConnected. Throws AndroidControllerException if device is not currently connected.

Throws:
AndroidControllerException

getSelectedDevice

String getSelectedDevice()
Returns:
the name of the currently selected device, or null if there is none
